title: UI Components Playground
description: Component library and playground to browse, test, and copy React UI across themes.
subtitle: React Component Library & Playground
overview: A modern library and playground for reusable React components across multiple themes. Discover components, tweak props live, and copy production-ready code.

coreConcept.summary: An integration hub for themed UI components.
bullets: One set of components, 6+ themes (Minimal, Modern, Gradient, Rounded, Dark, Neon)
Live props with instant preview and code output

features: Curated components: Button, Card, Input, Slider, Switch, Textarea, Toggle
Prop editing with type safety and code generation

frontendStack: Tailwind CSS with extended safelist for dynamic class generation
Monaco Editor for code editing and syntax highlighting
projectStructure: Dynamic Component Loading: runtime discovery and registration
Theme integration: components adapt to selected theme
Component tests for props and behavior
Performance: dynamic imports and code splitting
Component registry for discovery and metadata
deployment: Static export with dynamic features where needed
Optimized bundle via code splitting and lazy loading

personalExperience: The UI Components Playground was a fantastic learning experience that allowed me to explore component architecture and theme systems in depth. Building a system where components could adapt to multiple themes while maintaining consistency was challenging but rewarding. I learned a lot about CSS variables, dynamic class generation, and how to structure a component library for reusability. The interactive playground feature was particularly fun to implement, as it required real-time code generation and prop manipulation. This project helped me understand the importance of developer experience and how good tooling can accelerate development. It also reinforced my appreciation for well-designed component APIs and the power of composition in React.
